text: Werner von Salm-Reifferscheid (17 August 1545 - 16 December 1629) was a German nobleman who served as the ruler of Salm-Reifferscheid from 1559 to 1629. ==Life== He was the third son of Count Johann IX of Salm-Reifferscheid (1513–1559) and his wife Elisabeth of Henneberg-Schleusingen (1517–1577). He succeeded his father in 1559 and the ruled for 70 years until he died in 1629. He was notable for being against Protestantism.Anton Fahne: Geschichte der Grafen jetzigen Fürsten zu Salm-Reifferscheid. J. M. Heberle, Köln 1866, Erster Band und Köln 1858, Zweiter Band.Genealogisches Handbuch des Adels, Fürstliche Häuser. 1955 *Europaische Stammtafeln, by Wilhelm Karl, Prinz zu Isenburg, Vol. IV, Tafel 108.Werner Graf und Altgraf zu Salm-Reifferscheid- Dyck, genealogics.org, Genealogics – Leo van de Pas ==Marriage== Werner married on 21 August 1567 in Terborg , Gelderland , Netherlands , Countess Anna Maria von Limburg (c. 1543-1637), daughter of Count Georg von Limburg- Stierum and Countess Irmgard von Wisch. They had the following children: * Johann Christoph (21 September 1573 – 26 August 1600, killed in battle), canon at St. Gereon in Cologne * Hermann Adolf (5 March 1575 – 13 January 1637), Administrator-General of the Bishopric of Strasbourg * Wilhelm Salentin (12 January 1580 – 6 September 1634, killed in battle), canon at St. Gereon in Cologne * Elisabeth (5 October 1571 – c. 1616), married c. 1600 to Count Philipp Franz von Daun-Falkenstein (died 1616) * Ernst Friedrich (29 May 1583 – 13 September 1639), Count and Altgrave of Salm-Reiferscheid, married on 12 June 1616 to Countess Maria Ursula von Leiningen-Dagsburg-Falkenburg (1590 – 1649) * Irmgard (18 October 1568 – 22 June 1578), canoness in Thorn Werner also had illegitimate daughters: * Maria Sophia (born on 7 April 1577), canoness in Elten * Maximiliana (23 July 1578 – 1625), Canoness in Elten Cleves 8, genealogy.euweb.czSalm/Reifferscheid 2, genealogy.euweb.czWerner Altgraf zu Salm-Reifferscheidt, ww-person.comWerner, Altgraf zu Salm- Reifferscheidt in Reifferscheidt, Dyck, Alfter, Bedburg, & Hackenbroich, our- royal-titled-noble-and-commoner-ancestors.com ==References== Category:1545 births Category:1629 deaths Category:Monarchs in Europe Category:German people Category:16th century in Germany Category:17th century in Germany
title: Werner von Salm-Reifferscheid
